raw.title: [ARC] V3 Supply Cap Recommendations for Uncapped Assets (Fast-track)
raw.author: 0x8d4384046E47732EE7Ce8b7D96D15f7b9178FD2f
raw.body:
## Summary
The objective of this proposal by Chaos Labs is to recommend supply caps for v3 assets that are currently uncapped. This proposal follows the fast-track process for increasing supply caps as outlined [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/arc-v3-supply-borrow-cap-management-fast-track-process/8045). Itâ€™s important to note that these are initial supply caps for these assets and will be iterated upon. The recommendations for every asset on every chain take into consideration:

- Asset Market Cap
- Asset Counter Party Risk
- Asset Volume
- Asset Liquidity (DEX and CEX based)
- Historical Liquidations in times of high volatility

## Uncapped Assets

### Avalanche
![Screen Shot 2022-11-23 at 3.37.03 PM.png](ipfs://bafkreihvcnaftfhykgzuzqfw4alzlwworgz2v6s26g6acdf4r7twhle4zy)
     
 
### Optimism
![Screen Shot 2022-11-23 at 3.37.19 PM.png](ipfs://bafkreibhe4qkdrhmymwxxk7vjtfugtmtkharmhdknaxdcvhgncej2w5tse)

### Arbitrum 
![Screen Shot 2022-11-23 at 3.37.40 PM.png](ipfs://bafkreif3ttgogflynnmo7gxqjfhsbvzkpae6skmj2fx6p7vk55byony624)
*TVL of the deepest pool, captured on 11/22/22

cleaned.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 20m (Fast-track)
cleaned.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1

raw.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 20m (Fast-track)
raw.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1
raw.body:
Current parameters:

Supply cap: 10M sUSD â†’ 20m sUSD (proposed increase of supply cap)

DEX Liquidity: ~$50m+

Normal mode:

LTV: 60%

Liquidation threshold: 75%

Liquidation penalty: 5%

E-mode:

Assets: Stablecoins

Max LTV: 97%

Proposal: Increase of supply cap by 100% to 20m sUSD

The current sUSD supply cap on v3 is 10m sUSD and has been reached shortly after the launch of AAVE and Optimisms liquidity mining program on AAVE V3.

The proposalâ€™s goal is to suggest an increase of 100% to 20m sUSD supply cap via the fast-track process as outlined here

Reasons for increase:

sUSD Dex Liquidity: Despite market conditions, sUSD DEX liquidity vastly increased across Optimism on Curve, Uniswap, Velodrome, and others. This can facilitate healthy liquidations if ever necessary.

sUSDâ€™s Healthy Peg: Throughout the entire time sUSD has been an asset on AAVE, it has held peg and has not decreased within 1% of the expected peg of $1. This is due to increased sUSD Dex liquidity, and constant arbitrage of the peg by market makers.

Optimism Liquidity Mining: Due to the ongoing OP liquidity mining program on AAVE V3, the sUSD supply cap has been hit very quickly. To ensure that more users are able to supply/borrow on AAVE, it is important to increase this supply cap to ensure that there is ample amounts of sUSD available on AAVE.

We look forward to the discussion on increasing the Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 by 100% to 20m sUSD.

Note: Weâ€™ve used the template set by sAVAX when theyâ€™ve increased their supply cap via Fast-Track as well.

choices: Leave sUSD Supply Cap as is

raw.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 35m (Fast-track)
raw.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1
raw.body:
Current parameters:

Supply cap: 20M sUSD â†’ 35m sUSD (proposed increase of supply cap)

DEX Liquidity: ~$50m+

Normal mode:

LTV: 60%

Liquidation threshold: 75%

Liquidation penalty: 5%

E-mode:

Assets: Stablecoins

Max LTV: 97%

Proposal: Increase of supply cap by 75% to 35m sUSD

The current sUSD supply cap on v3 is 20m sUSD and may be reached as the market is already ~70% full. To ensure that this cap isnâ€™t hit and supply rates drastically increase, it is crucial to increase the cap before then.

The proposalâ€™s goal is to suggest an increase of 75% to 35m sUSD supply cap via the fast-track process as outlined here

Reasons for increase:

sUSD Dex Liquidity: Despite market conditions, sUSD DEX liquidity vastly increased across Optimism on Curve, Uniswap, Velodrome, and others. This can facilitate healthy liquidations if ever necessary.

sUSDâ€™s Healthy Peg: Throughout the entire time sUSD has been an asset on AAVE, it has held peg and has not decreased within 1% of the expected peg of $1. This is due to increased sUSD Dex liquidity, and constant arbitrage of the peg by market makers.

Optimism Liquidity Mining: Due to the ongoing OP liquidity mining program on AAVE V3, the sUSD supply cap has been hit very quickly. To ensure that more users are able to supply/borrow on AAVE, it is important to increase this supply cap to ensure that there is ample amounts of sUSD available on AAVE.

Note: Weâ€™ve used the template set by sAVAX when theyâ€™ve increased their supply cap via Fast-Track as well and have used the prior increase for sUSD as a template.

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to implement borrow caps for seven uncapped assets and adjust borrow caps for nine assets across four chains in Aave V3. The vote timeline and analytics strongly favor 'YAE', with stable and early unanimous support. Forum sentiment shows mostly neutral to negative commentary, primarily about process speed, but no strong opposition. Historical similar proposals recommended borrow cap adjustments with positive vote outcomes and no adverse post-vote impacts.
key_arguments_for: Strong early and stable voting support for 'YAE' option throughout the voting period.
Similar prior proposal successfully implemented supply cap recommendations without negative market or TVL impacts.
Borrow caps help manage risk by limiting exposure to certain assets, protecting protocol health.
Fast-track process is established and was adhered to, ensuring governance efficiency.
key_arguments_against: Some community members expressed concern about the short discussion time before the snapshot vote.
Negative sentiment from a few forum comments regarding transparency and timing.
Minor discrepancy found post-vote in AIP payload numbers, though it resulted in more conservative caps.
Market impact shows slight declines in token price and TVL, though not linked directly to proposal execution.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion showed initial negative sentiment on fast-track timing but no opposition to proposal substance.
Voting was unanimous for 'YAE' with 100% lead ratio in all quartiles and high stability.

evidence.reference: V3 Supply Cap Recommendations for Uncapped Assets
evidence.quote: Previous similar proposal passed with strong support and resulted in no negative market or TVL impact.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline analytics show unanimous and stable support for 'YAE', indicating strong governance alignment.
- Forum sentiment was mostly neutral with some negative comments about voting speed but did not oppose the proposal content, suggesting sentiment generally supports the change.
- Similar past proposals for supply and borrow caps were successful and did not negatively affect market or TVL, providing a precedent and confidence in this proposal.
- Although token price and TVL showed slight declines, these are not attributed to the proposal execution and do not outweigh the governance and risk management benefits.
- The recommendation aligns with aggregated voting sentiment and supports the protocol's long-term health by managing borrowing risks.
